conversion_verification.notes: Render is a true cutaway 3D model with extruded walls, visible thickness, an angled/isometric camera, and the ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor geometry simplifications at corners/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK arrangement, living/dining core, kitchen/utility on right, balconies positioned plausibly. Some internal partitioning (notably entry/passage area) appears altered/smoothed into curved segments vs the more rectilinear 2D plan; several small spaces (toilets/utility partitions) are hard to verify as exact matches.

interior_elements.notes: Beds in bedrooms, sofa/living set, dining table, kitchen counters/appliances, and bathroom fixture blocks present; generally placed in appropriate rooms with reasonable scale.

visual_clarity.notes: Good material consistency and lighting; geometry is readable with minimal artifacts. Some openings (especially windows) are not strongly delineated, reducing structural legibility.

detected_errors.description: Internal wall/partition geometry around the entrance/passage appears modified (curved/reshaped) compared with the rectilinear 2D plan, risking adjacency/proportion drift.
Doors/windows are not consistently verifiable on the exact walls shown in the 2D plan; several openings are simplified or unclear (notably window placement).
Rendering prioritizes simplified clean forms over explicit architectural detailing, which slightly reduces verification precision for small rooms/partitions.

summary: A valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric depiction and furnishings, but with some notable internal partition deviations and unclear opening fidelity versus the 2D plan.
